questions.question: What is Jibra'il's main responsibility?
options: Delivering Allah's revelation to all the prophets
Blowing the trumpet on Judgment Day

questions.question: How many wings did the Prophet ﷺ see when Jibra'il appeared in his true form?
options: Six hundred wings covering the horizon

questions.question: According to the Qur'an 53:5-6, who taught the Prophet ﷺ?
options: One intense in strength who rose to his true form

questions.question: How did Jibra'il teach the companions about Islam?
options: By asking the Prophet ﷺ questions while they listened

questions.question: What does Mīkā'īl control to provide sustenance?
What is Mīkā'īl responsible for distributing?
options: Rain and provisions to all of Allah's creation

questions.question: According to Qur'an 2:98, who is mentioned alongside Jibra'il?
What does Mīkā'īl remind us about our food and water?
options: We must work hard for it
We should share it with others
Every drop and bite comes from Allah's mercy and provision
It will run out one day

questions.question: Why does the Prophet ﷺ teach us to always be prepared?
options: Because Isrāfīl has been ready since creation and the Hour could come at any moment
Because we need to help others

questions.question: What happens when Isrāfīl blows the trumpet the first time?
options: The sun rises from the west
Every living thing in the heavens and earth dies except whom Allah wills

questions.question: What is Isrāfīl's main task?
options: Blowing the trumpet to signal the Day of Judgment

questions.question: What does the second blow of the trumpet do?
options: It brings all creation back to life for judgment
It opens the gates of Paradise

questions.question: According to Qur'an 32:11, what happens after the Angel of Death takes our soul?
options: To our Lord we will be returned
We wait in the grave forever

questions.question: What is another name often used for the Angel of Death?
How does the Angel of Death extract the souls of believers?
Who will be the last to die before the Day of Judgment?
What are the three questions Munkar and Nakir ask in the grave?
options: Who is your Lord? What is your religion? Who is your Prophet?
Did you pray? Did you fast? Did you give charity?
Where are you from? Who are your parents? What did you do?
Do you believe? Do you repent? Do you remember?

questions.question: What happens to the grave of a sincere believer after answering correctly?
options: It becomes spacious, filled with light and pleasant fragrance

questions.question: According to Sahih Bukhari 1377, what did the Prophet ﷺ seek refuge from?
What happens to those who cannot answer Munkar and Nakir's questions?
options: They get another chance to answer
They wait until Judgment Day in peace
Their grave becomes tight, dark, and filled with punishment

questions.question: What do the guardian angels protect us from?
options: Harm and dangers we never even see or know about

questions.question: According to Qur'an 13:11, where are the guardian angels positioned?
options: Only above us in the sky
Before and behind us, protecting by Allah's command

questions.question: When do the guardian angels draw closer to increase their protection?
options: When we remember Allah and maintain good character

questions.question: When can the guardian angels no longer protect us?
options: When we are alone at night
When our decreed time of death arrives

questions.question: What does the angel on the left do before recording a sin?
options: Records it immediately like good deeds
Waits to give us time to repent and seek forgiveness
Warns us not to do it again

questions.question: Where do the two recording angels sit?
options: One on the right shoulder and one on the left

questions.question: How does the angel on the right record good deeds?
options: Immediately and multiplies them by ten or more
Exactly as they are without multiplication

questions.question: According to Qur'an 50:18, what is recorded by the angels?
options: Only what we do in public

questions.question: What does the Qur'an 43:77 say Mālik will respond when people beg for death?
options: He will ask Allah for permission
You must wait one thousand years

questions.question: Why does Mālik never smile?
options: He is stern and serious, reflecting the terrible reality of Hellfire's punishment
Angels are not allowed to smile
He is always busy with his duties
He is waiting for Allah's next command

questions.question: What is Mālik's role?
options: Gatekeeper of Hellfire, commanding nineteen chief angels

questions.question: What did the Prophet ﷺ teach us to do regarding Hellfire in every prayer?
options: Thank Allah for not being there

questions.question: Who is Ridwān?
options: The gatekeeper of Paradise who welcomes believers
The angel who blows the trumpet
The angel who records good deeds

questions.question: According to Qur'an 39:73, what do the keepers of Paradise say to believers?
options: Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally

questions.question: What is the highest level of Paradise that the Prophet ﷺ taught us to ask for?
options: Firdaws, the best and highest part

questions.question: What does Ridwān oversee in Paradise?
options: The distribution of Paradise's levels according to each person's deeds

questions.question: Why did the Prophet ﷺ refuse to let the Angel of the Mountains destroy Taif?
options: He hoped Allah would bring from their descendants people who worship Allah alone
He was afraid of the consequences
He wanted to punish them himself later

questions.question: What did the Angel of the Mountains offer to do to the people of Taif?
options: Send a flood to their city
Send storms to destroy their homes

questions.question: According to Sahih Bukhari 3231, what quality did the Prophet ﷺ show by refusing revenge?
options: Wisdom and mercy, choosing forgiveness over revenge

questions.question: What happened to the people of Taif after the Prophet ﷺ showed them mercy?
options: Many later accepted Islam and became devoted believers

questions.question: What did the Prophet ﷺ say happens in the heavens according to Sahih Muslim 2785?
options: Angels rest and take turns worshipping
The heavens creak from angels in prostration in every space
Only a few angels worship at a time

questions.question: How do the countless angels in the heavens worship Allah?
options: For a few hours each day
Day and night without stop, never disobeying

questions.question: What did the Prophet ﷺ say about the space in the heavens?
options: It is mostly empty and quiet
There is not a hand's width without an angel in worship
Angels only gather in certain areas
The heavens have rooms for angels to rest

questions.question: What should we learn from the angels' constant worship?
options: We should dedicate our lives to remembrance and obedience of Allah
We can worship less since angels do so much
Worship is only for angels, not humans
We should only worship on special days
